title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Greffes [Grafting], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service], 1821–24
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Greffes [Grafting], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and blue ink on mount, lower center:  Les Greffes
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer A. Samuels, New York.
description: Scene in garden behind a grand house, right middle ground.  The lady of the house, center foreground, discusses the grafting of bushes with the gardener.  A small child plays, right foreground.  Two gardener's assistants in left middleground; one holds the sapling while the other fills dirt around its roots.  An orangerie, left background, amidst trees and bushes, appears behind a low garden wall.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Greffes [Grafting], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service], 1821–24. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper. 
1989-13-3
